ignore_mcu_update_on_datapoints.docs:
**, list**: A list of datapoints to ignore MCU updates for.  Useful for certain broken/erratic hardware and debugging.

*See also: [Tuya MCU](https://esphome.io/components/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

on_datapoint_update.docs:
An automation to perform when a Tuya datapoint update is received. See [on_datapoint_update](https://esphome.io/components/tuya.html#tuya-on-datapoint-update).

*See also: [Tuya MCU](https://esphome.io/components/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

datapoint_type.docs:
**, string**: The datapoint type one of *raw*, *string*, *bool*, *int*, *uint*, *enum*, *bitmask* or *any*.

*See also: [Tuya MCU](https://esphome.io/components/tuya.html#on-datapoint-update)*

sensor_datapoint.docs:
**, int**: The datapoint id number of the sensor.

*See also: [Tuya MCU](https://esphome.io/components/tuya.html#on-datapoint-update)*

status_pin.docs:
**, [Pin Schema](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin-schema)**: Some Tuya devices support WiFi status reporting ONLY through gpio pin. Specify the pin reported in the config dump or leave empty otherwise. More about this [here](https://developer.tuya.com/en/docs/iot/tuya-cloud-universal-serial-port-access-protocol?id=K9hhi0xxtn9cb#title-6-Query%20working%20mode).

*See also: [Tuya MCU](https://esphome.io/components/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

time_id.docs:
**, [ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Some Tuya devices support obtaining local time from ESPHome. Specify the ID of the [Time Component](https://esphome.io/components/time/index.html) which will be used.

*See also: [Tuya MCU](https://esphome.io/components/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

sensor_datapoint.docs:
**, int**: The datapoint id number of the binary sensor.

*See also: [Tuya Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

active_state.docs:
Configuration for the Active State detection (or HVAC mode setting and reporting).
  * **datapoint** (**Required**, int): The datapoint id number of the active state - [see below](https://esphome.io/components/climate/tuya.html#active-state-detection).
  
  * **heating_value** (*Optional*, int): The active state datapoint value when in heating mode. Defaults to `1` - [see below](https://esphome.io/components/climate/tuya.html#active-state-detection).
  
  * **cooling_value** (*Optional*, int): The active state datapoint value when in cooling mode - [see below](https://esphome.io/components/climate/tuya.html#active-state-detection).
  
  * **drying_value** (*Optional*, int): The active state datapoint value when in drying mode.
  
  * **fanonly_value** (*Optional*, int): The active state datapoint value when in fan-only mode.
  
  

*See also: [Tuya Climate](https://esphome.io/components/climate/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

cooling_value.docs:
**, int**: The active state datapoint value when in cooling mode - [see below](https://esphome.io/components/climate/tuya.html#active-state-detection).

*See also: [Tuya Climate](https://esphome.io/components/climate/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

datapoint.docs:
**, int**: The datapoint id number of the active state - [see below](https://esphome.io/components/climate/tuya.html#active-state-detection).

*See also: [Tuya Climate](https://esphome.io/components/climate/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

drying_value.docs:
**, int**: The active state datapoint value when in drying mode.

*See also: [Tuya Climate](https://esphome.io/components/climate/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

fanonly_value.docs:
**, int**: The active state datapoint value when in fan-only mode.

*See also: [Tuya Climate](https://esphome.io/components/climate/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

heating_value.docs:
**, int**: The active state datapoint value when in heating mode. Defaults to `1` - [see below](https://esphome.io/components/climate/tuya.html#active-state-detection).

*See also: [Tuya Climate](https://esphome.io/components/climate/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

cooling_state_pin.docs:
**, [Pin](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin)**: The input pin indicating that the device is cooling - [see below](https://esphome.io/components/climate/tuya.html#active-state-detection). Only used if **active_state_datapoint** is not configured.

*See also: [Tuya Climate](https://esphome.io/components/climate/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

current_temperature_datapoint.docs:
**, int**: The datapoint id number of the current temperature.

*See also: [Tuya Climate](https://esphome.io/components/climate/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

current_temperature_multiplier.docs:
**, float**: A multiplier to modify the current temperature value.

*See also: [Tuya Climate](https://esphome.io/components/climate/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

fan_mode.docs:
Configuration for fan modes/fan speeds.
  * **datapoint** (**Required**, int): The datapoint id number of the Fan value state.
  
  * **auto_value** (*Optional*, int): The datapoint value the device reports when the fan is on `auto` speed.
  
  * **low_value** (*Optional*, int):  The datapoint value the device reports when the fan is on `low` speed.
  
  * **medium_value** (*Optional*, int):  The datapoint value the device reports when the fan is on `medium` speed.
  
  * **middle_value** (*Optional*, int):  The datapoint value the device reports when the fan is on `middle` speed. (May set to device’s `high` value if you have a `Turbo` option).
  
  * **high_value** (*Optional*, int):  The datapoint value the device reports when the fan is on `high` speed. (Sometimes called `Turbo`).
  
  

*See also: [Tuya Climate](https://esphome.io/components/climate/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

auto_value.docs:
**, int**: The datapoint value the device reports when the fan is on `auto` speed.

*See also: [Tuya Climate](https://esphome.io/components/climate/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

datapoint.docs:
**, int**: The datapoint id number of the Fan value state.

*See also: [Tuya Climate](https://esphome.io/components/climate/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

high_value.docs:
**, int**: The datapoint value the device reports when the fan is on `high` speed. (Sometimes called `Turbo`).

*See also: [Tuya Climate](https://esphome.io/components/climate/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

low_value.docs:
**, int**: The datapoint value the device reports when the fan is on `low` speed.

*See also: [Tuya Climate](https://esphome.io/components/climate/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

medium_value.docs:
**, int**: The datapoint value the device reports when the fan is on `medium` speed.

*See also: [Tuya Climate](https://esphome.io/components/climate/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

middle_value.docs:
**, int**: The datapoint value the device reports when the fan is on `middle` speed. (May set to device’s `high` value if you have a `Turbo` option).

*See also: [Tuya Climate](https://esphome.io/components/climate/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

heating_state_pin.docs:
**, [Pin](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin)**: The input pin indicating that the device is heating - [see below](https://esphome.io/components/climate/tuya.html#active-state-detection). Only used if **active_state_datapoint** is not configured.

*See also: [Tuya Climate](https://esphome.io/components/climate/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

preset.docs:
Configuration for presets.
  * **eco** (*Optional*): Configuration for Eco preset.
    * **datapoint** (**Required**, int): The datapoint id number of the Eco action.
    
    * **temperature** (*Optional*, int): Temperature setpoint for Eco preset.
    
    
  
  * **sleep** (*Optional*): Configuration for Sleep preset
    * **datapoint** (**Required**, int): The Datapoint id number of the Sleep Action
    
    
  
  

*See also: [Tuya Climate](https://esphome.io/components/climate/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

eco.docs:
Configuration for Eco preset.
  * **datapoint** (**Required**, int): The datapoint id number of the Eco action.
  
  * **temperature** (*Optional*, int): Temperature setpoint for Eco preset.
  
  

*See also: [Tuya Climate](https://esphome.io/components/climate/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

datapoint.docs:
**, int**: The datapoint id number of the Eco action.

*See also: [Tuya Climate](https://esphome.io/components/climate/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

temperature.docs:
**, int**: Temperature setpoint for Eco preset.

*See also: [Tuya Climate](https://esphome.io/components/climate/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

sleep.docs:
Configuration for Sleep preset
  * **datapoint** (**Required**, int): The Datapoint id number of the Sleep Action
  
  

*See also: [Tuya Climate](https://esphome.io/components/climate/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

datapoint.docs:
**, int**: The Datapoint id number of the Sleep Action

*See also: [Tuya Climate](https://esphome.io/components/climate/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

reports_fahrenheit.docs:
**, boolean**: Set to `true` if the device reports temperatures in Fahrenheit. ESPHome expects all climate temperatures to be in Celcius, otherwise unexpected conversions will take place when it is published to Home Assistant. Defaults to `false`.

*See also: [Tuya Climate](https://esphome.io/components/climate/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

supports_cool.docs:
**, boolean**: Specifies if the device has a cooling mode. Defaults to `false`.

*See also: [Tuya Climate](https://esphome.io/components/climate/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

supports_heat.docs:
**, boolean**: Specifies if the device has a heating mode. Defaults to `true`.

*See also: [Tuya Climate](https://esphome.io/components/climate/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

swing_mode.docs:
Configuration for the swing (oscillation) modes.
  * **vertical_datapoint** (*Optional*, int): The datapoint id number of the vertical swing action.
  
  * **horizontal_datapoint** (*Optional*, int): The datapoint id number of the horizontal swing action.
  
  

*See also: [Tuya Climate](https://esphome.io/components/climate/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

horizontal_datapoint.docs:
**, int**: The datapoint id number of the horizontal swing action.

*See also: [Tuya Climate](https://esphome.io/components/climate/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

vertical_datapoint.docs:
**, int**: The datapoint id number of the vertical swing action.

*See also: [Tuya Climate](https://esphome.io/components/climate/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

switch_datapoint.docs:
**, int**: The datapoint id number of the climate switch (device on/off).

*See also: [Tuya Climate](https://esphome.io/components/climate/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

target_temperature_datapoint.docs:
**, int**: The datapoint id number of the target temperature.

*See also: [Tuya Climate](https://esphome.io/components/climate/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

target_temperature_multiplier.docs:
**, float**: A multiplier to modify the target temperature value.

*See also: [Tuya Climate](https://esphome.io/components/climate/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

temperature_multiplier.docs:
**, float**: A multiplier to modify the incoming and outgoing temperature values - [see below](https://esphome.io/components/climate/tuya.html#temperature-multiplier).

*See also: [Tuya Climate](https://esphome.io/components/climate/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

control_datapoint.docs:
**, int**: The datapoint id number for sending control commands.

*See also: [Tuya Cover](https://esphome.io/components/cover/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

direction_datapoint.docs:
**, int**: The datapoint id number for setting the direction of travel.

*See also: [Tuya Cover](https://esphome.io/components/cover/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

invert_position.docs:
**, boolean**: Sets the direction of travel to be inverted, if direction_datapoint is configured.

*See also: [Tuya Cover](https://esphome.io/components/cover/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

invert_position_report.docs:
**, boolean**: Invert reported position percentages calculated from `min_value` and `max_value` i.e. 70% becomes 30%.  Defaults to false.

*See also: [Tuya Cover](https://esphome.io/components/cover/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

max_value.docs:
**, int**: the highest position value, meaning cover opened. Defaults to 255.

*See also: [Tuya Cover](https://esphome.io/components/cover/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

min_value.docs:
**, int**: The lowest position value, meaning cover closed. Defaults to 0.

*See also: [Tuya Cover](https://esphome.io/components/cover/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

position_datapoint.docs:
**, int**: The datapoint id number of the cover position value.

*See also: [Tuya Cover](https://esphome.io/components/cover/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

position_report_datapoint.docs:
**, int**: The datapoint id number of the cover position report value, if separate from position_datapoint.

*See also: [Tuya Cover](https://esphome.io/components/cover/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

direction_datapoint.docs:
**, int**: The datapoint id number of the direction switch. Supported by some ceiling fans.

*See also: [Tuya Fan](https://esphome.io/components/fan/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

oscillation_datapoint.docs:
**, int**: The datapoint id number of the oscillation switch. Probably not supported on any Tuya controllers currently, but it’s there if need be.

*See also: [Tuya Fan](https://esphome.io/components/fan/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

speed_count.docs:
**, int**: Set the number of supported discrete speed levels. Defaults to `3`.

*See also: [Tuya Fan](https://esphome.io/components/fan/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

speed_datapoint.docs:
**, int**: The datapoint id number of the fan speed.

*See also: [Tuya Fan](https://esphome.io/components/fan/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

switch_datapoint.docs:
**, int**: The datapoint id number of the fan switch.

*See also: [Tuya Fan](https://esphome.io/components/fan/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

cold_white_color_temperature.docs:
**, float**: The color temperature (in [mireds](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mired) or Kelvin) of the cold white channel.

*See also: [Tuya Dimmer](https://esphome.io/components/light/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

color_datapoint.docs:
**, int**: The datapoint id number of the color value. If this is set, along with **color_type**, then ESPHome will set the color value formatted based on the **color_type**.

*See also: [Tuya Dimmer](https://esphome.io/components/light/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

color_temperature_datapoint.docs:
**, int**: The datapoint id number of the color temperature value.

*See also: [Tuya Dimmer](https://esphome.io/components/light/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

color_temperature_invert.docs:
**, boolean**: Control how color temperature values are sent to the MCU. If this is set to true ESPHome will treat 0 as warm white and **color_temperature_max_value** as cool white when setting **color_temperature_datapoint**. Defaults to false.

*See also: [Tuya Dimmer](https://esphome.io/components/light/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

color_temperature_max_value.docs:
**, int**: The highest color temperature value allowed. Some ceiling fans have a value of 100 (also for `max_value`). Defaults to 255.

*See also: [Tuya Dimmer](https://esphome.io/components/light/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

color_type.docs:
**, enum**: The color type to use when setting the **color_datapoint**. If this is set, along with **color_datapoint**, then ESPHome will use this value to format the color sent to **color_datapoint**.
  * `rgb`: Use a 6 digit hex RGB value
  
  * `hsv`: Use a 12 digit hex HSV value
  
  * `rgbhsv`: Use a 14 digit hex RGBHSV value
  
  

*See also: [Tuya Dimmer](https://esphome.io/components/light/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

HSV.docs: Use a 12 digit hex HSV value

RGB.docs: Use a 6 digit hex RGB value

RGBHSV.docs: Use a 14 digit hex RGBHSV value

dimmer_datapoint.docs:
**, int**: The datapoint id number of the dimmer value.

*See also: [Tuya Dimmer](https://esphome.io/components/light/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

max_value.docs:
**, int**: The highest dimmer value allowed.  Most dimmers have a maximum of 255, but dimmers with a maximum of 1000 can also be found. Try what works best. Defaults to 255.

*See also: [Tuya Dimmer](https://esphome.io/components/light/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

min_value.docs:
**, int**: The lowest dimmer value allowed.  My dimmer had a minimum of 25 and wouldn’t even accept anything lower, but this option is available if necessary. Defaults to 0.

*See also: [Tuya Dimmer](https://esphome.io/components/light/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

min_value_datapoint.docs:
**, int**: The datapoint id number of the MCU minimum value setting.  If this is set then ESPHome will sync the **min_value** to the MCU on startup.

*See also: [Tuya Dimmer](https://esphome.io/components/light/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

switch_datapoint.docs:
**, int**: The datapoint id number of the power switch.  My dimmer required this to be able to turn the light on and off.  Without this you would only be able to change the brightness and would have to toggle the light using the physical buttons.

*See also: [Tuya Dimmer](https://esphome.io/components/light/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

warm_white_color_temperature.docs:
**, float**: The color temperature (in [mireds](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mired) or Kelvin) of the warm white channel.

*See also: [Tuya Dimmer](https://esphome.io/components/light/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

datapoint_hidden.docs:
Specify information required for hidden datapoints.
  * **datapoint_type** (**Required**, string): The datapoint type, one of *int*, *uint*, *enum*.
  
  * **initial_value** (*Optional*, float): The value to be written at initialization. Must be between `min_value` and `max_value`.
  
  * **restore_value** (*Optional*, boolean): Saves and loads the state to RTC/Flash. Defaults to `false`.
  
  

*See also: [Tuya Number](https://esphome.io/components/number/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

datapoint_type.docs:
**, string**: The datapoint type, one of *int*, *uint*, *enum*.

*See also: [Tuya Number](https://esphome.io/components/number/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

initial_value.docs:
**, float**: The value to be written at initialization. Must be between `min_value` and `max_value`.

*See also: [Tuya Number](https://esphome.io/components/number/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

restore_value.docs:
**, boolean**: Saves and loads the state to RTC/Flash. Defaults to `false`.

*See also: [Tuya Number](https://esphome.io/components/number/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

max_value.docs:
**, float**: The maximum value this number can be.

*See also: [Tuya Number](https://esphome.io/components/number/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

min_value.docs:
**, float**: The minimum value this number can be.

*See also: [Tuya Number](https://esphome.io/components/number/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

multiply.docs:
**, float**: multiply the new value with this factor before sending the requests.

*See also: [Tuya Number](https://esphome.io/components/number/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

number_datapoint.docs:
**, int**: The datapoint id number of the number.

*See also: [Tuya Number](https://esphome.io/components/number/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

step.docs:
**, float**: The granularity with which the number can be set. Defaults to 1.

*See also: [Tuya Number](https://esphome.io/components/number/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

enum_datapoint.docs:
**, int**: The enum datapoint id number for the select.

*See also: [Tuya Select](https://esphome.io/components/select/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

optimistic.docs:
**, boolean**: Whether to operate in optimistic mode - when in this mode, any command sent to the Select will immediately update the reported state.

*See also: [Tuya Select](https://esphome.io/components/select/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

options.docs:
**, Map[int, str]**: Provide a mapping from values (int) of this Select to options (str) of the *enum_datapoint* and vice versa. All options and all values have to be unique.

*See also: [Tuya Select](https://esphome.io/components/select/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

sensor_datapoint.docs:
**, int**: The datapoint id number of the sensor.

*See also: [Tuya Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

switch_datapoint.docs:
**, int**: The datapoint id number of the switch.

*See also: [Tuya Switch](https://esphome.io/components/switch/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

sensor_datapoint.docs:
**, int**: The datapoint id number of the sensor.

*See also: [Tuya Text Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/text_sensor/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*
